elements.name: question1
elements.title: Please list any Consultants away on leave below

elements.name: question6
elements.html:
Trainee Performance Key

Not Satisfactory

Borderline

Satisfactory

Well above Average

- Not satisfactory

- Not meeting expectations for level of training

- Regular &/or significant omissions or errors

- Little, slow &/or inconsistent progress

- Requires frequent correction or instruction

- Requires intense monitoring and supervision compared to expected for level of training

- Borderline performance

- Not meeting expectations for level of training

- Some minor omissions or errors

- Requires above average instruction for level of training

- Requires further training to improve

- Satisfactory

- Performs as expected for level of training

- Requires average level of instruction or correction for level

- Performs consistently above level of training

- No omissions or errors

- Requires minimal instruction or correction

rows.text: Is developing a knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and pathology relating to the common disease processes of most common paediatric surgical conditions.
Basic knowledge of paediatric surgical conditions – can discuss key points of most conditions.
Can explain the basic science basis for most common elective paediatric surgical conditions.
Demonstrates mechanisms to correct knowledge deficits, seldom says “I don’t know” to the same question when asked on another occasion.
Demonstrates familiarity with common paediatric surgical texts and journals during discussions with trainers.
Routinely utilises knowledge together with results of investigations to explain clinical manifestations of common elective paediatric surgical conditions.

elements.name: question34
elements.title: Global Assessment of Basic Clinical Science Knowledge: Acquisition and Application
elements.description: Select the descriptor that best describes the Trainee's overall global progress in basic clinical sciences knowledge

choices.text: Not showing satisfactory aptitude for achieving Early SET One competencies In Clinical Science Knowledge
Showing progression towards critical competencies in Clinical Science Knowledge but needs further training and study
Has achieved all Early SET One critical competencies in Clinical Science Knowledge
Achieved Early SET One critical competencies and progressing well in Early SET Two in Clinical Science Knowledge
Achieved Early SET critical competencies and progressing in Mid-SET in Clinical Science Knowledge

elements.name: question46
elements.title: Verbal description of clinical assessment / Case Presentations

rows.text: Takes a comprehensive and pertinent history
Organised in standard format
Able to discuss clinical relevance of clinical signs.
Maintains adequate, accurate and complete medical records
Legible
Evidence of reasonable organisation of thoughts and findings
Thorough examination
Competent when eliciting symptoms and signs in a cooperative patient in a controlled environment.
Obtains clinical information in a manner cognisant of cultural and social factors

elements.name: question49
elements.title: Demonstration of Clinical Competence in Diagnosis

rows.text: Good interpretation of clinical features. Readily recognises and manages straightforward clinical situations.
Has situational awareness of having encountered new clinical situations.
Uses knowledge to analyse clinical findings
Recognises most common issues of paediatric surgical significance
Fully involved in post-op care
Recognises complications early
“Hands-on” approach to post-operative care
Appropriate co-ordination and use of other personnel

elements.name: question51
elements.title: Global Assessment of Medical Expertise
elements.description: Select  the descriptor that best describes the Trainee's overall global progress in Medical Expertise

choices.text: Not showing satisfactory aptitude for achieving Early SET One competencies In Medical Expertise in Paediatric Surgery
Showing progression towards critical competencies In Medical Expertise but needs further training and study
Has achieved all Early SET One critical competencies in Medical Expertise
Achieved Early SET One critical competencies and progressing well in Early SET Two in Medical Expertise
Achieved Early SET critical competencies and progressing in Mid-SET in Medical Expertise

pages.name: page2

rows.text: Recognises significance of clinical findings. Appropriately seeks guidance to manage the clinical situation.
Recognises and responds to needs specific in paediatric patients
Aware of limitations
Appropriate reaction to emergencies, can initiate first response to most common paediatric surgical emergencies.
Seeks advice appropriately
Protocol-appropriate selection and use of investigative tools
Aware of how the usefulness of most common investigations can be limited by commonly evident patient factors.
Can interpret common investigations, seeks expert mentoring of interpreting unfamiliar investigations
A structured management plan is always put forward.
Aware of treatment options used for common paediatric elective surgical presentations.
Prompt flagging of patient complications
Manages patients with sensitivity to physical, social, cultural and psychological needs
Identifies and manages risks by seeking appropriate advice and authorisation.

elements.name: question17
elements.title: Global Assessment of Clinical Judgement
elements.description: Select  the descriptor that best describes the Trainee's overall global progress in Clinical Judgement

choices.text: Not showing satisfactory aptitude for achieving Early SET One competencies in Clinical Judgement in Paediatric Surgery
Showing progression towards critical Competencies In Clinical Judgement but needs further training and study
Has achieved all Early SET One critical competencies in Clinical Judgement
Achieved Early SET One critical competencies and progressing well in Early SET Two in Clinical Judgement
Achieved Early SET critical competencies and progressing in Mid-SET in Clinical Judgement

pages.title: Judgement  Clinical Decision-making
pages.description: Application of knowledge, clinical information, and signs elicited to form a management plan

rows.text: Highly motivated. Learns avidly
Ensures team works efficiently by organising activities in a timely manner
Able to deconstruct observed technical skills and cognitively rehearse and then practice them.
Competent hand-eye co-ordination
Excellent pre-operative preparation and demonstrates procedural knowledge of most elective procedures encountered.
Follows theatre protocols
Identifies that different techniques are observed and notes the advantages and disadvantages of differing approaches.
Can sequentially talk through the steps of common elective procedures and anticipate the instruments required for each
Delicate with tissue handling
All knot tying secure
Meticulous technique while still making progress. Understands that most operations are well-performed simple skills applied in a sequential pattern.
Recognises the level of skill required differs in different stages of a procedure and differs in different patients according to anatomy, pathology and comorbidity.
Safe and constantly improving knowledge of anatomy of common elective procedures
Verbally demonstrates improved surgical judgement during procedures.
Seeks assistance appropriately
In control of self in emergency
Able to maintain surgical judgement and safely complete surgical procedures under pressure while supervised
Can follow and understand changes in operative plan made by Consultant and can readily discuss factors contributing to the need for a change in plan.

elements.name: question20
elements.title: Global Assessment of Technical Skills
elements.description: Select  the descriptor that best describes the Trainee's overall global progress in Technical Skills

choices.text: Not showing satisfactory aptitude for achieving Early SET One technical competencies in Paediatric Surgery
Showing progression towards critical technical competencies but needs further training and study
Has achieved all Early SET One critical technical competencies
Achieved Early SET One critical competencies and progressing well in Early SET Two with technical competencies
Achieved Early SET critical competencies and progressing in Mid-SET with technical competencies

rows.text: Demonstrates a genuine interest in ad hoc and structured teaching
Well prepared presentations delivered clearly and logically
Clear study plan and preparation for the RACS Clinical Examination
Clear study plan and preparation for the Anatomy and Embryology Examination
Recognises performance gaps in junior medical officers
Reflects on own performance and improvement and demonstrates this to mentors by inquiry and seeking feedback
Shows and interest in learning through research
Recognises value of research knowledge applied to clinical practice
Flair to research
Shows initiative and independence
Completes project
Good grasp of statistics and research method

elements.name: question22
elements.title: Publications
elements.commentText: List current projects and research involvement:

rows.text: Active in publication
Conscientious with audit
Keen to present at meetings

elements.name: question23
elements.title: Global Assessment of Scholar and Teacher
elements.description: Select  the descriptor that best describes the Trainee's overall global progress in Scholar and Teacher

choices.text: Not showing satisfactory aptitude for achieving Early SET One Scholar and Teacher competencies in Paediatric Surgery
Showing progression towards critical competencies in Scholar and Teacher but needs further training and study
Has achieved all Early SET One critical competencies in Scholar and Teacher
Achieved Early SET One critical competencies and progressing well in Early SET Two in Scholar and Teacher
Achieved Early SET critical competencies and progressing in Mid-SET in Scholar and Teacher

rows.text: Attentively listens to patients and their families, peers and colleagues.
Sensitive to verbal and non-verbal cues received from patients and families especially regarding their serious concerns and can relay these to their senior colleagues
Communicates with children in a way appropriate to developmental level
Provides information enabling informed consent for procedures in Early SET One workbook and appropriate Early SET conditions
Always willing to help, even if personally inconvenient
Good rapport with peers, initiates resolution of misunderstanding
Supportive and good relationship with junior staff
Skilled at defusing problems in surgical team
Actively seeks opinions of nursing and ancillary staff about concerns for patients
Functions well as member of team, takes responsibility for allocated role
Consults well with colleagues and other professionals
Is able to review ward patients and be ready for theatre on time.
Uses resources effectively for patient care and balances them with patient needs
Willing to contribute to health services management

elements.name: question28
elements.title: Global Assessment of Medical Communication Skills
elements.description: Select  the descriptor that best describes the Trainee's overall global progress in Medical Communication Skills

choices.text: Not showing satisfactory aptitude for achieving Early SET One Medical Communication competencies in Paediatric Surgery
Showing progression towards critical competencies in Medical Communication but needs further training
Has achieved all Early SET One critical competencies in Medical Communication
Achieved Early SET One critical competencies and progressing well in Early SET Two in Medical Communication
Achieved Early SET critical competencies and progressing in Mid-SET in Medical Communication

rows.text: Consistently deals with the challenges presented by different value systems
Assists patients and families to consider options and make decisions
Keeps family and carers informed about current status and next steps. Advises families and patients on relevant risk factors.
Recognises the impact on families and carers of rescheduling surgery.
Recognises key health issues arising from the different cultural values. Identifies vulnerable populations that may have limited access to health care resources.

elements.name: question33
elements.title: Global Assessment of Health Advocacy
elements.description: Select  the descriptor that best describes the Trainee's overall global progress in Health Advocacy

choices.text: Not showing satisfactory aptitude for achieving Early SET One Health advocacy competencies in Paediatric Surgery
Showing progression towards critical health advocacy competencies but needs further training
Has achieved all Early SET One critical competencies in Health Advocacy
Achieved Early SET One critical competencies and progressing well in Early SET Two in Health Advocacy
Achieved Early SET critical competencies and progressing in Mid-SET in Health Advocacy

rows.text: Displays initiative
Punctual
Up to date with work
Well organised
Ready accessibility
Always completes tasks on time
Reliable and dependable
Efficient, anticipates well
Strong advocate for the sick child
Copes well
Responds well to problems
Seeks help when required
In control in critical situation
Accepts responsibility for mistakes
Openly learns from errors

elements.name: question37
elements.title: Professionalism
elements.commentText: List current projects and research involvement:

rows.text: Identifies and applies ethical principles related to paediatric surgery
Recognises medicolegal implications of paediatric surgical issues
Readily accountable for own decisions/actions
Responds constructively to criticism.
Supports colleagues and junior staff
Demonstrates insight into own performance
Identifies and applies ethical principles related to paediatric surgery
Honest. Admits mistakes.
Keen to rectify deficiencies. Proactive in organising own remedial programme if needed. Minimises own mistakes
Demonstrates insight into own performance. Does not repeat errors and addresses issues when advised. Self-critical and incisive.
Demonstrates self-health advocacy and prioritises patient and personal safety
